About OverDrive

The goal of OverDrive Addendum is to make it easier to find populer ebooks that are available for checkout from your public library via OverDrive. But what exactly is OverDrive?

OverDrive is a platform for lending ebooks. Libraries across the country use OverDrive to make their ebook collections accesible to patrons. Your public library card will give you access to all of the ebooks owned by your public library network. You can also access these ebooks across your devices through OverDrive's Libby app.

If you have further questions about using OverDrive or need to find out if your library uses it, click here to visit OverDrive's website.

Finding a library's short url

To find your library's short name, navigate to your library's OverDrive page. This can be found either directly from your library's webpage or from a web search.

The URL for that OverDrive site will take the form abc.overdrive.com. The abc is the library short name that needs to be entered into the box at the top of the search page.

The Boston Public Library's OverDrive URL is bpl.overdrive.com, so the library short name would be bpl.
